intro: Siphocampylus scaber, commonly known as the roughleaf siphocampylus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile, where it thrives in temperate climates. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture, giving it its scientific name. Its small white to yellowish flowers appear in clustered umbels, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
